name: SOS Music Media
slogan: SOS (Society of Sound) Music Media was established to showcase music that means something
description: We showcase different artists who create lyrics, music, and music videos that capture the inner-workings of our society.

team.name: Tanner Taddeo
team.bioHtml: International social finance and development professional passionate about startups, technology and global challenges.

team.title: Co-Founder
team.name: Leland T. Holcomb
team.bioHtml: Head of Scouting @Startupbootcamp, Insurtech & Impact Investment

team.title: Contributing writer
team.name: Esther Miller
team.bioHtml: Radio Presenter for the past 3 years and counting, Voice Over Artist, UX / UI Designer, I ‚ù§ Figma, WordPress, Bootstrap. Freelance Writer (Music and lifestyle).

jobs.title: Content Creator - Meaningful Music Evangelist
jobs.description:
- Find music/music videos that touch upon prominent social issues (e.g. race relations, gender equality, mental health etc.)
- Write on the meaning in the music
- Promote the artist, issue, and article through social media outlets
- Generate buzz and conversation around the issue, artist and issue

If you would like to be a part of the "Society of Sound" simply submit songs (and/or videos, original or otherwise!) that you think fit our mold (i.e. songs about prominent social issues that promote dialogue on societal/cultural issues) along with an article (see sosmusicmedia.com and the attached for article format and samples) that discusses the meaning of the song. 

Full disclosure, we are at a very early stage and this is a passion project for us, so we are unable to pay at this time (since we aren't making any yet and have already invested a substantial amount of personal money to get this off the ground!), but of course would give you full credit for authorship and will be giving paid roles to those that stick with us if we are successful moving forward. 

We have two key levels of potential involvement: content contributor (write articles that are the core content on the platform) or CMO, which is a more involved role where you will join our core team. 

Our content contributors are the key part of our SOS family so we have an internal network where we discuss music and social impact and we also have opportunities for contributors to take part in the podcast, etc. It really is based on your level of interest! We have recently moved into phase two of the business so we are optimistic and excited and looking for someone who can help achieve this vision!
jobs.descriptionHtml:
• Find music/music videos that touch upon prominent social issues (e.g. race relations, gender equality, mental health etc.)
  • Write on the meaning in the music
  • Promote the artist, issue, and article through social media outlets
  • Generate buzz and conversation around the issue, artist and issue

If you would like to be a part of the "Society of Sound" simply submit songs (and/or videos, original or otherwise!) that you think fit our mold (i.e. songs about prominent social issues that promote dialogue on societal/cultural issues) along with an article (see sosmusicmedia.com and the attached for article format and samples) that discusses the meaning of the song.

Full disclosure, we are at a very early stage and this is a passion project for us, so we are unable to pay at this time (since we aren't making any yet and have already invested a substantial amount of personal money to get this off the ground!), but of course would give you full credit for authorship and will be giving paid roles to those that stick with us if we are successful moving forward.

We have two key levels of potential involvement: content contributor (write articles that are the core content on the platform) or CMO, which is a more involved role where you will join our core team.

Our content contributors are the key part of our SOS family so we have an internal network where we discuss music and social impact and we also have opportunities for contributors to take part in the podcast, etc. It really is based on your level of interest! We have recently moved into phase two of the business so we are optimistic and excited and looking for someone who can help achieve this vision!
